title: EPIONE
content:
EPIONE was the goddess of the soothing of pain. She was the wife of the medicine-god Asklepios (Aslcepius) and
        the mother of the five Asklepiades (Asclepiades)--Hygeia (Good Health), Panakeia (Cure-All), Iaso (Healing),
        Aigle (Radiance), and Akeso (Curing).

[1.1] MAKHAON, PODALEIRIOS, IASO, AIGLE, PANAKEIA, HYGEIA (by Asklepios) (Greek Lyric V Frag 939 Erythrae
          Inscription)
        [1.2] IASO, AIGLE, HYGEIA, AKESO, PANAKEIA (by Asklepios) (Suidas s.v. Epione)

Greek Lyric V Anonymous, Fragment 939 (Inscription from Erythrai) (trans. Campbell)
          (Greek lyric B.C.) :
        "Asklepios (Asclepius), the most famous god--ie Paian! By him were fathered Makhaon (Machaon) and
        Podaleirios (Podalirius) and Iaso (Healer)--ie Paian!--and fair-eyed Aigle (Radiance) and Panakea
        (Panacea, Cure-all), children of Epione, along with Hygieia (Health), all-glorious, undefiled."

Pausanias, Description of Greece 2. 29. 1 (trans. Jones) (Greek travelogue C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "[In the city of Epidauros in Argolis] is a precinct of Asklepios (Asclepius), with images of the god
        himself and Epione. Epione, they say, was the wife of Asklepios. These are of Parian marble, and are set up in
        the open."

Suidas s.v. Epione (trans. Suda On Line) (Byzantine Greek Lexicon C10th A.D.)
          :
        "Epione : wife of Asklepios (Asclepius), and daughters named Hygeia, Aigle (Aegle), Iaso, Akeso (Aceso),
        Panakeia (Panacea)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
